column5: Latest;PARIS (Reuters) – Cambodia reported a first outbreak of African swine fever (ASF) in backyard pigs near the Vietnam border
column6: the Paris-based World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE) said on Wednesday
column7: citing the Cambodian agriculture ministry.------The disease
column8: which is incurable in pigs but harmless to humans
column9: has spread rapidly across China before hitting Vietnam in February.------Some 400 pigs were killed by ASF in Soamkanign in the Rattanakiri province in an outbreak that began on March 22
column10: according to the Cambodian agriculture ministry’s report. Another 100 pigs were killed and disposed of.------China
column11: home to the world’s largest hog herd
column12: has reported 116 outbreaks of ASF since the disease was first detected last August
column13: although many believe it is much worse than officially reported.------Reporting by Sybille de La Hamaide Editing by Gus Trompiz------Reuters
